title.native: デジモンフロンティア

description:
Takuya Kanbara is an average city kid who receives a text message from an unknown source instructing him to "board a train towards his destiny". Taking up the Call to Adventure, he finds the train in question and is whisked off to the Digital World, which is currently under threat from the malevolent Cherubimon. Cherubimon and his minions are consuming the very building blocks of the Digital World (its "Fractal Code") to increase their own power, and if nothing is done then the entire Digital World will be devoured.

All is not lost, however. Takuya and the other "chosen" children who boarded the train inherit the power of the Ten Legendary Warriors that saved the Digital World in the distant past, allowing them to transform themselves into Digimon. With their new powers, they fight to take back the stolen Fractal Code and restore the fractured Digital World to its former glory.

(Source: TV Tropes)

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
__Height:__ 174 cm (5'8'') 

[Profile](https://intention-k.com/profile/kenichi_suzumura) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzu__kensan)

His favorite animals are dogs, and he has two dogs named Ivy and Momo. His favorite foods are curry and Pino ice cream. He enjoys cooking and playing video games. He can speak in the Kansai-ben dialect. He has a younger brother, Masaki, and an older sister, Shizuka. He has practiced aikido.  

He left Artvision in 2012 and has found his own talent agency INTENTION. He is part of the voice actor unit STA☆MEN, alongside Junichi Suwabe, Daisuke Kishio, Hiroki Takahashi, Hiroyuki Yoshino, Makoto Yasumura, and Kousuke Toriumi. They performed the ending theme for the Tokusatsu drama "Go Busters" of the Super Sentai Series and released it as their third single. He's also part of CONNECT, first unit of Kiramune, with Mitsuo Iwata. They released three mini-albums and a single. As a solo artist, he has released 13 singles, 3 albums and 2 mini-albums.  

Married frequent costar [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/Maaya-Sakamoto) on August 8, 2011.

__Agency:__ Ogipro The Next Co. Inc.

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/takeuchi-junko/) | [Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/junkotakeuchi45)

Married to voice actor [Kenji Hamada](https://anilist.co/staff/95371/Kenji-Hamada) since 2006 and has two children.

**Height:** 167 cm (5'6") 
**Other:** Named his cat "Nyanko-Sensei" 
**Agency:** Aoni

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/kamiya-hiroshi.html)

On January 1st 2025 it was announced that he had gotten married to actress and gravure model Rina Aizawa.

**Awards:**
- 2008-03: Best Supporting Actor, 2nd Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2009-03: Best Lead Actor and Best Personality, 3rd Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2012-03: Most Votes Award, 6th Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2013-03: Most Votes Award, 7th Annual Seiyuu Awards  

Hosts several radio talk shows, including Dear Girl ~Stories~ with Ono Daisuke. In May 2010, he and Miyu Irino formed a Kiramune unit called KAmiYU, and sang the theme song for Mokei Senshi Gunpla Builders Beginning G.  Their first mini-album "link-up" was released on August 3, 2011.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Neuvillette in Genshin Impact
- Shou Ronpo in Uchu Sentai Kyuranger
- Madrex in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

__Height__: 154 cm
__Hobbies__: watching professional wrestling

Was married to [Kouji Tsujitani](https://anilist.co/staff/95427) until his death.

Mary Elizabeth McGlynn is an American voice actress, ADR director and singer-songwriter best known for her involvement in music production in multiple games from the Silent Hill series, and her extensive English-language dubbing of various anime, animated films and video games.

[Profile (Aoni)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/maeda-ai.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ai_max)

Married to [Ryoutarou Okiayu](https://anilist.co/staff/95177/Ryoutarou-Okiayu)

_Not to be confused with the model and actress [Ai Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/95647) who has only voiced Kino._

[Profile (Aoni)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/maeda-ai.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ai_max)

Married to [Ryoutarou Okiayu](https://anilist.co/staff/95177/Ryoutarou-Okiayu)

_Not to be confused with the model and actress [Ai Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/95647) who has only voiced Kino._

He's credited on all relevant media as the creator of the original concept and character designs for the virtual pet franchise, Digimon. However, nothing is known about Hongo as an individual.

The name is actually a pseudonym for the three most important figures in the creation of the Digimon franchise: Aki Maita, one of the two creators of the original Tamagotchi; Hiroshi Izawa, the author of the first Digimon manga; and Takeichi Hongo, the director of marketing for Bandai.

(Source: Digimon Wikia)

[Website](http://wadakoji.com/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/和田光司)

Kouji Wada was best known for performing several songs for the [Digimon](https://anilist.co/anime/552/) series.

On April 3, 2016, he suddenly passed away due to complications related to nasopharynx cancer.

[Website](http://wadakoji.com/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/和田光司)

Kouji Wada was best known for performing several songs for the [Digimon](https://anilist.co/anime/552/) series.

On April 3, 2016, he suddenly passed away due to complications related to nasopharynx cancer.
Spanish voice actress and vocalist of the music group Liquid Sun.

Takanori Arisawa was a Japanese composer and arranger from Tokyo. He wrote the background music for several notable anime, including the award-winning soundtrack of the Sailor Moon anime series.    He died of bladder cancer at 54 years of age.    As the Music Director for Sailor Moon, Arisawa's first award was the 1993 Golden Disk Grand Prize from Columbia Records. He continued to compose for the entire anime series, plus several video games and some of the stage musicals. In 1998, 2000, and 2001 he won the JASRAC International Award for most international royalties, owing largely to the popularity of Sailor Moon music in other nations.    Arisawa expressed an admiration of Hollywood-style music, drawing his initial inspiration for the tone of the Sailor Moon soundtrack from the Charlie's Angels TV series. He frequently made use of symbolism when writing themes for specific characters or groups, borrowing thematic elements from diverse genres and from other countries. As the series progressed, his music gravitated from a pop feeling toward more classical arrangements to represent the protagonist having passed through painful experiences and grown as a person.    Source: Wikipedia

Chronology:  (2007) changed name to Michael Shitanda (四反田マイケル)  Skills & Abilities:  English  Non-anime roles:  Gojiro Kiryu (English and Japanese voices) in "Samurai Western" (VG)  Parfait in "Galaxy Angel II: Mugen Kairo no Kagi" (VG) (Japanese)  The Toyman in "Superman: The Animated Series" (Japanese)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oja0222digi)

Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) since 1987.

[Seki-sensei](https://anilist.co/character/14098/) in [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) is named after her.
